Make sure you are going to every lab. the labs are small assignments that are designed to be completed WITHIN the lab section so umm.. you should be able to if you leverage out all the resources like the people around you are allowed to collaborate in the labs that's fine.
So leverage like the people sitting in desks around you, leverage the course staff okay.. umm and you should be able to complete the lab during the lab section
Umm.. All the lab is again to give you a little bit more programming experience it will be a little more closely aligned to the lecture most of the time.

The labs are NOT for completing the homework and the MPs. I'll ask the course staff to prioritize lab questions over MP questions so if you are in the lab section and you are trying to ask a question about a homework while there are 5 other people who are just trying to do the lab, they are not gonna answer the MP questions they are gonna answer the 5 people who are trying to do the lab.
Go to the lab sections with the expectation that you are gonna be  doing the lab in the lab section.
If you have MP questions go to the office hours.

Right so like all the labs will be consistently due at 11:00 two days after the lab section.
So you do have time after the lab to finish it up if you didn't finish. But you should be able to get a VAST majority of it done during the lab if not completely done during the lab.
They will be autograded using the same autograding system we use in the class.. umm. no late submissions are expected because again it's already too late
Labs taking place before the exam dates are reserved for exam review. So if you are looking for an exam review section that's it.
Okay so if you go to the lab the day before the exams that will be a review session.
I urge you to go to those prepared with questions to ask them cause if you go there to just to expecting them to review material for you
Oh and there armed with questions ready to interrogate them and then they'll they'll feel that if you have about any

MPs so the MPs make up the bulk of the programming assignments of the class these are the big ones these are due roughly one a week. Umm... Depending on the assignment you...it's either going to be a solo MP meaning you must work individually on your own with no one else in the class with no else who has taken the class. The only collaborator can be course staff.
OR a partner MP which means ONE partner means TWO right.. so two people working on one assignment and that's it.
NOT a group of 3, not a group of 4 NOT a group of two partners who happen to talk and then Ohh your code looks exactly the same as you used on submission for it. No that's plagiarism.
TWO people in a group is a partner group that's ok ONLY on MPs that are marked as partner MPs.
MPs that are marked as solo MPs don't have a partner. Because then you are gonna be talking with me about why you have a partner for a solo mp
Okay so make sure you are looking at that.
Each Mp is gonna be broken into two or three parts depending on the assignments.
So some of the ones that have a little bit more material on them may be cut into smaller parts so that you can kinda get a little bit more piecemeal progress on them.
